ygData.subject: Re: Publish and be damned?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... papers ... style? ... I forgot to answer this part.  I think this community is AI in general, but you can t go wrong just follow GA/NN/EC conventions.

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Ian Badcoe <ian_badcoe@y...> wrote:
> 
> Right=
.  What is "this community"?  i.e. how wide does the style 
> spread.  I ha=
ve written papers in the past, but they were for 
> biochemistry and you ar=
e quite right, when I read CS papers these 
> days the style always does su=
btly jar with me.  But are all CS 
papers 
> the same, or does the GA/NN/EC=
 etc etc community have its own sub-
style?
> 

I forgot to answer this par=
t.  I think "this community" is AI in 
general, but you can't go wrong just=
 follow GA/NN/EC conventions.  
The style may extend to the broader CS comm=
unity but I don't read 
enough papers outside AI to be sure.  I do know tha=
t other 
disciplines, such as in the humanities, have very different styles=
 
and conventions.  Even biology is different enough that I would not 
feel=
 confident writing a biology paper for publication even if I 
knew what I w=
as talking about.

ken
